item.title: Doing Data Science (Book)
item.author: jonthelaion@icloud.com (jonthelaion)
item.description: With years of experience in both academia and industry, authors Cathy O’Neil & Rachel Schutt look beyond the hype to explore what the data science discipline entails and looks like in practice. They also explore an idea that is often overlooked when speaking about data science - that building models and working with data is not value-neutral. You choose the problems you will work on, you make assumptions in those models, you choose metrics, and you design the algorithms.

item.title: R Resources
item.author: jonthelaion@icloud.com (jonthelaion)
item.description: Blogs Cathy O’Neil Blog Data Science Central R Markdown Creating Websites with R Markdown (Currently Reading) General Data Science Doing Data Science Columbia - Applied Data Science Learning R The Art of R Programming - Norman Matloff (No Starch Press) R for Everyone: Advanced Analytics and Graphics - Jared Lander (Addison-Wesley) R in a Nutshell - Joseph Adler (O’Reilly) Learning Python Learning Python - Mark Lutz and David Ascher (O’Reilly) Python for Data Analysis - Wes McKinney (O’Reilly) Math Linear Algebra and Its Applications - Gilbert Strang (Cengage Learning) Convex Optimization - Stephen Boyd and Lieven Vandenberghe (Cambridge University Press) A First Course in Probability - Sheldon Ross (Academic Press) Data Analysis and Statistical Inference Statistical Inference - George Casella and Roger L.

item.title: Hello World
item.author: jonthelaion@icloud.com (jonthelaion)
item.description: Creating this blog to journal my progress towards becoming a data scientist an applied statistician. While my interest in this field was initially piqued by the data science hype train, I feel that my view of this discipline is more closely aligned with the traditional school of applied statistics, rather than the newer “hacker-culture” school of data science. I hope that one day I can learn enough about the art of working with data in an imperfect and uncertain world to be able to use modern statistical techniques and make a positive contribution to society.
